string.text:
Barkeep is the proprietor of the 100 Rads bar in Rostok.
 
In addition to the obvious functions of managing the bar and serving drinks - he rents rooms, pays out bribes and supplies stalkers with plenty of equipment and work.
 
Along with Sidorovich and Strelok, he was instrumental in the opening of roads leading toward the center of the Zone.
 
He is neither a saint nor a scoundrel, but is highly respected among stalkers, especially those in the Duty faction - his main patrons.

Beard smuggles artifacts and tends bar aboard the Skadovsk.
 
Conducting his personal artifact smuggling business from his bar, he has no shortage of people in need of work, and is a regular employer to many near the Zone's center.
 
He often finds himself at odds with Owl, who always seems to have a hand in disrupting his business enterprises one way or the other.

Nimble is a profiteer who sells smuggled weapons and outfits.
 
Starting out as a member of Clear Sky, and then as a courier for Sidorovich, he has assembled a list of important contacts allowing him to build his own business.
 
Having learned from the best and survived everything thrown at him, he has become one of the most proficient and well-known traders in the Zone.
 
Unlike other traders however, he specialises in the sale of rare equipment, items that can be very difficult to obtain, but almost always worth the money invested.

Sidorovich trades out of an old bunker near the rookie village.
 
He enjoys a reputation of being a fairly honest businessman who gives newcomers a chance to survive, and his wealth of contacts allows him to smuggle in goods many here consider a luxury.
 
However many also see him as greedy and tight-fisted, those who try to compete with him on his own territory, or just disgruntle him in general, often end up on the wrong side of an assassination contract.
 
Whether for good or bad, he continues to play an integral role within the Zone's economy and its faction's politics, as such he is a great source of work for those wanting to earn a quick payday.
